text: is an ancient history of Japan written in 797.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Shoku Nihongi" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 883. This work is the second of the Rikkokushi ("Six National Histories"). It was written after the Nihon Shoki and before the Nihon Kōki. Sugeno Mamichi was the main editor. Shoku Nihongi is a primary historical source of information about Japan's Nara period. The work covers the 95-year period from the beginning of Emperor Mommu's reign in 697 until the 10th year of Emperor Kammu's reign in 791. The text is an account of nine imperial reigns.Bender, Ross. "Performative Loci of Shoku Nihongi Edicts, 749-770" ; retrieved 2011-12-29. == References == ==Further reading== * Sakamoto, Tarō. (1991). The Six National Histories of Japan (tr. John S. Brownlee). Tokyo: University of Tokyo Press. == Other websites == * Shoku Nihongi text * Shoku Nihongi text * Waseda University Library, Shoku Nihongi manuscript Category:History of Japan Category:8th- century books
title: Shoku Nihongi
